meanings.definition: The official power to make legal decisions and judgments.
meanings.sent1: In some jurisdictions, judges are elected by the people.
meanings.sent2: Different jurisdictions have varying laws regarding traffic violations.
meanings.sent3: The cat declared itself the ruler of all feline jurisdictions in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: Her expertise in navigating legal jurisdictions made her the go-to person for advice.
meanings.sent5: The boundaries of his jurisdictions were as clear as the lines on a map.

meanings.definition: The extent or range of authority or control.
meanings.sent1: The company's jurisdictions expanded to cover multiple states.
meanings.sent2: As a manager, she had to respect the jurisdictions of her team members.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel claimed the entire park as its jurisdiction, demanding all acorns as tribute.
meanings.sent4: His charisma extended beyond his official jurisdictions, influencing people far and wide.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's jurisdiction over the classroom was evident in the orderly behavior of the students.
